oracle.jbo.jbotester.dialog
Class VariableDialog

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component

          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Dialog
                  javax.swing.JDialog
                      oracle.jbo.jbotester.dialog.JTDialog
                          oracle.jbo.jbotester.dialog.GenericDialog
                              oracle.jbo.jbotester.dialog.VariableDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public final class VariableDialog
extends GenericDialog
implements java.awt.event.FocusListener

The Variable shows the bind variables for a view. Each variable can be selected and modified. The dialog shows when a view with bind variables is shown for the first time (and no values are set). The user may also select the toolbar button to change the values of the bind variables. The VariableDialog uses a card layout to handle the text fields below the list. The default, name, type and value text fields for each bind variable form one card and based on the list selection the right card is displayed The value text field in the Variable Dialog is a bound text field and this value is updated into the underlying VO on click of the OK button, which is also a bound field that is bound to ExecWithParams action binding

See Also:
Serialized Form
